original_definition: 'rated heat output' means the declared heat output of a solid fuel boiler when providing heating of enclosed spaces with the preferred fuel, expressed in kW;
generated_definition: NO JSON AS AN OUTPUT OBTAINED

Article 1: 1.   Without prejudice to Directive 2010/75/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council (5), this Regulation establishes ecodesign requirements for placing on the market and putting into servicesolid fuel boilers with arated heat output of 500 kilowatt (‘kW’) or less, including those integrated in packages of a solid fuel boiler, supplementary heaters, temperature controls and solar devices as defined in Article 2 of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/1187.

1.   Without prejudice to Directive 2010/75/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council (5), this Regulation establishes ecodesign requirements for placing on the market and putting into service solid fuel boilers with a rated heat output of 500 kilowatt (‘kW’) or less, including those integrated in packages of a solid fuel boiler, supplementary heaters, temperature controls and solar devices as defined in Article 2 of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/1187.
Article 2: ‘rated heat output’ or ‘Pr’ means the declared heat output of asolid fuel boilerwhen providing heating of enclosed spaces with thepreferred fuel, expressed in kW;
‘rated heat output’ or ‘Pr’ means the declared heat output of a solid fuel boiler when providing heating of enclosed spaces with the preferred fuel, expressed in kW;

‘solid fuel boiler’ means a device equipped with one or moresolid fuel heat generators that provides heat to awater-based central heating systemin order to reach and maintain at a desired level the indoor temperature of one or more enclosed spaces, with a heat loss to its surrounding environment of not more than 6 % ofrated heat output;

‘solid fuel boiler’ means a device equipped with one or more solid fuel heat generators that provides heat to a water-based central heating system in order to reach and maintain at a desired level the indoor temperature of one or more enclosed spaces, with a heat loss to its surrounding environment of not more than 6 % of rated heat output;
Article 7: to include solid fuel boilers with a rated heat output of up to 1 000 kilowatt;
to includesolid fuel boilers with arated heat output of up to 1 000 kilowatt;
Article 9: seasonal space heating energy efficiency for boilers with a rated heat output of 20 kW or less shall not be less than 75 %;

‘applicable part load’ means for automatically stokedsolid fuel boilers, operation at 30 % ofrated heat output, and for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of rated heat output, operation at 50 % of rated heat output;
for automatically stokedsolid fuel boilers, a weighted average of the useful efficiency atrated heat output and the useful efficiency at 30 % of the rated heat output, expressed in %;

Es,p
 are the emissions of respectively particulate matter, organic gaseous compounds, carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides measured at 30 % or 50 % of rated heat output, as applicable;

for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of the rated heat output in continuous mode, a weighted average of the useful efficiency at rated heat output and the useful efficiency at 50 % of the rated heat output, expressed in %;
for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that cannot be operated at 50 % or less of the rated heat output in continuous mode, and for solid fuel cogeneration boilers:
seasonal space heating energy efficiencyfor boilers with arated heat output of 20 kW or less shall not be less than 75 %;

‘electric power requirement at maximum heat output’ or ‘elmax
’ means the electric power consumption of the solid fuel boiler at rated heat output, expressed in kW, excluding electricity consumption from a back-up heater and from incorporated secondary emission abatement equipment;
for automatically stoked solid fuel boilers, a weighted average of the emissions at rated heat output and the emissions at 30 % of the rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3;
for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that cannot be operated at 50 % or less of the rated heat output in continuous mode, the emissions at rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3;
for solid fuel cogeneration boilers, the useful efficiency at rated heat output, expressed in %;
for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of the rated heat output in continuous mode, and for automatically stoked solid fuel boilers:

Es,n
 are the emissions of respectivelyparticulate matter, organic gaseous compounds, carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides measured atrated heat output.

for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of the rated heat output in continuous mode, a weighted average of the emissions at rated heat output and the emissions at 50 % of the rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3;
for manually stokedsolid fuel boilers that cannot be operated at 50 % or less of therated heat outputin continuous mode, and forsolid fuel cogeneration boilers:
for automatically stokedsolid fuel boilers, a weighted average of the emissions atrated heat output and the emissions at 30 % of the rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3;
for manually stokedsolid fuel boilers that cannot be operated at 50 % or less of therated heat output in continuous mode, the useful efficiency at rated heat output, expressed in %;

for manually stokedsolid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of therated heat output in continuous mode, a weighted average of the useful efficiency at rated heat output and the useful efficiency at 50 % of the rated heat output, expressed in %;

for manually stokedsolid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of therated heat output in continuous mode, a weighted average of the emissions at rated heat output and the emissions at 50 % of the rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3;

‘electric power requirement at maximum heat output’ or ‘elmax
’ means the electric power consumption of thesolid fuel boileratrated heat output, expressed in kW, excluding electricity consumption from a back-up heater and from incorporated secondary emission abatement equipment;

‘applicable part load’ means for automatically stoked solid fuel boilers, operation at 30 % of rated heat output, and for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of rated heat output, operation at 50 % of rated heat output;
seasonal space heating energy efficiency for boilers with a rated heat output of more than 20 kW shall not be less than 77 %;
for manually stokedsolid fuel boilers that can be operated at 50 % of therated heat output in continuous mode, and for automatically stoked solid fuel boilers:
for automatically stoked solid fuel boilers, a weighted average of the useful efficiency at rated heat output and the useful efficiency at 30 % of the rated heat output, expressed in %;
for manually stokedsolid fuel boilers that cannot be operated at 50 % or less of therated heat output in continuous mode, the emissions at rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3;
for manually stoked solid fuel boilers that cannot be operated at 50 % or less of the rated heat output in continuous mode, the useful efficiency at rated heat output, expressed in %;
for solid fuel cogeneration boilers, the emissions at rated heat output, expressed in mg/m3.

Es,p
 are the emissions of respectivelyparticulate matter, organic gaseous compounds, carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides measured at 30 % or 50 % ofrated heat output, as applicable;
seasonal space heating energy efficiencyfor boilers with arated heat output of more than 20 kW shall not be less than 77 %;
At rated heat output
At [30 %/50 %] of rated heat output, if applicable

Es,n
 are the emissions of respectively particulate matter, organic gaseous compounds, carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides measured at rated heat output.
